newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian wool indicator falls one ct/kg.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian wool indicator falls one ct/kg.

text.p: The Australian wool market eastern indicator fell by one cent to 552 cents a kg clean at sales in Sydney and Geelong on Thursday, Wool International (WI) said.
Merino fleece prices were mixed, with 19 micron up to one percent cheaper, 20/21/25 microns were slightly cheaper, while 22 micron was 0.5 percent dearer and 23/24 micron slightly dearer.
Merino skirtings tended lower with 19 microns unchanged and 20/21 microns up to one percent cheaper.
Crossbreds also tended lower with 26 micron unchanged and 27/28/29 micron 0.5 percent cheaper and 30/31 microns one percent cheaper.
WI said most buying came from Japan and China with good support from Taiwan.
Of the 15,925 bales on offer, 19.3 percent was passed in.
Sales continue next week in Newcastle, Adelaide and Launceston with about 90,800 bales on offer.
